column4: I'm trying to uninstall a program Irssi. Where do I type 'make uninstall' (in the source folder? where is that?) Thanks for any help.
did you install irssi from source?
do you still have the source folder?
Is the source folder the tar I untarred?
How do I manually uninstall it, or is it safe to reinstall it via apt-get (I just found a source link to install it via apt-get)?
well, then the only way to attempt a make install is to download the source again, compile it but dont install it (via 'make install'), then issue a 'make uninstall'
if you ever compile from source, you must build a .deb file so apt can remove it later .. otherwise it's a headache
Okay, I will look into that, thanks.
Is there any other way to uninstall the program? I unpacked the same .tar in the same directory, but I cannot make uninstall (make: *** No rule to make target 'uninstall'. Stop.). Thanks.

you probably need to run ./configure (and whatever else README/INSTALL tells you to do) and make before the uninstall target can be used -- again, there is no guarantee that you can run a 'make uninstall' not all makefiles support it
try and not build from source unless absolutely necessary -- if ever you do, use the ubuntu sources and always build a .deb
